title-group.article-title: A Descriptive Analysis of the Time Series Behavior of Financial Analysts' Earnings Forecasts

abstract.p: This paper presents an empirical examination of quarterly changes in consensus analyst forecasts of annual earnings and the dispersion of the individual forecasts comprised by the consensus. This study analyzes quarterly changes in these variables using a time series of forecasts beginning with a seven quarter ahead forecast for a large sample of firms. The median quarterly change in consensus analyst forecasts was found to be a series of small negative changes. Analyst forecast dispersion, when measured by the coefficient of variation instead of the across-analyst standard deviation, declines throughout the horizon.
